system.biography:
TitleFFF 804c Gargu-Khanu Gladiator
Birthday02 Nuzyael 708
AppearanceAge 11, height 4’5”, heavy frame (size 5), 113 lb, pallid complexion, black hair, black eyes.
Medical/Psyche
Size0
ArmorPlain leather apron and leggings; Chain armlette, kurbul ailette, and shield. Spear and broadsword.
Other EquipmentNone
Valuables20 pence worth of brass rings
Notes

Biography

Thardic slavers comb the wilderness of Hârn to find exotic beasts for the Pamesani arenas. Although difficult to come by, gargun are a regular favorite. Their predilection for violence suits this purpose well.

Akeur’s first fight was against an injured Laranian knight taken by Agrikans in a skirmish against the Order of the Checkered Shield. Akeur knocked the knight down and stunned him with a spiked club. Akeur raped the dazed and bloodied knight, then tore the wretch’s throat open with his fangs. The sheer brutality of the spectacle drove the depraved crowd ecstatic. Akeur’s star has been in ascension since that day.

Akeur, now called “The Black Death,” is a regular favorite of the games. He has achieved an impressive record of 42 fights in his five years at the arena, scoring 38 kills and 4 draws. He has fought slaves, beasts, ivashu, human gladiators, and other gargun. He has fought on teams but is unpopular with other gladiators because his Khanu battle frenzy has resulted in a fair number of fatalities amongst his teammates. His signature moves of bashing victims down, violating them (be they beasts or men), and biting out their throats is a sure crowd pleaser. He has learned passable Hârnic so that he may taunt his foes and encourage the roar of the crowds with his diatribes and colorful insults.

Akeur has a number of jaded Thardic patrons, including a particularly perverse senator, and therefore receives special attention by his handlers. He receives regular training, an all-meat diet, and slaves to disport himself with. Sometimes the slaves, be they female or male, barely survive the experience; most do not.

HOOKS

Are You Not Entertained? The PCs are to be participants in the Pamensani games. They find themselves facing “The Black Death.” His patrons do not wish to lose an investment like Akeur and typically ensure the fights are close, but not too close.

“We Who Are About to Die for the Greater Glory of Agrik Salute You!” A Laranian knight was recently taken by Agrikans in battle. His fate includes ritual torture followed by death at the hands of “The Black Death” in the Pamesani games. The PCs are hired to rescue him by any means necessary, maybe even by participating in the games!

I’m Gargacus! Akeur has escaped from the arena with a band of fellow gladiators. Embarrassed by the carnage he wrought during the escape, his patrons hire the PCs to hunt down their wayward charge and kill him before he encourages more slaves to revolt.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Part 13” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/fff-gargu/), by Shawn Bond, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
